description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jv8v","text":"This procedure describes the concentration and quantification of SARS-CoV-2 from wastewater as used by the Environmental Monitoring for Health Protection (EMHP) in England programme during the COVID-19 pandemic. It is based on the standard operating procedure developed by a collaboration between Environment Agency National Laboratory Service and Bangor University. This generic protocol was prepared by Cefas to allow laboratories to carry out SARS-CoV-2 quantification from wastewater samples in a way that is similar to the EA‚Äôs procedure, while still allowing some variation where necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6aio4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97rjo","text":"Viral concentration is by ammonium sulphate precipitation followed by centrifugation. Viral RNA extraction is by lysis with guanidine isothiocyanate (GITC) and adsorption to silica. Extracted viral RNA is amplified and detected by quantitative RT-PCR (RT-qPCR). This protocol describes a method for quantification of virus RNA in the test sample and includes production of control materials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7j7q","text":"\nThe wastewater samples are first clarified by centrifugation. A precipitant (ammonium sulphate) is then added before the sample is incubated for 1 hour at 4¬∞C. This is followed by centrifugation to generate a viral pellet that is suitable for viral nucleic acid extraction. Details of addition of a spike process control (phi6) to the test samples are also described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ohd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8492q","text":"It is necessary to extract RNA using a method that yields clean RNA preparations to reduce the effect of PCR inhibitors. In this protocol the chaotropic agent GITC is used to disrupt the viral capsid. RNA is then adsorbed to silica to assist purification through several washing stages. Purified viral RNA is released from the silica into a buffer prior to RT-qPCR. The use of the Thermofisher KingFisher Flex Purification System with BioMerieux‚Äôs NucliSENS extraction reagents is described here. Other RNA extraction methods that use GITC followed by silica-based purification may also be applicable if they can be demonstrated to give equivalent results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a1n2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbg8","text":"This protocol uses one-step RT-qPCR using hydrolysis probes. In one-step RT-qPCR, reverse transcription and PCR amplification are carried out consecutively in the same tube. Hydrolysis probe-based qPCR utilises a short DNA probe with a fluorescent label and a fluorescence quencher attached at opposite ends. The assay chemistry ensures that as the quantity of amplified product increases, the probe is broken down, and the fluorescent signal from the label increases proportionately. Fluorescence may be measured at each stage throughout the cycle. The first point in the PCR cycle at which amplification can be detected for any reaction is proportional to the quantity of template, therefore analysis of the fluorescence plots enables determination of the quantity of target sequence in the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lrhr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"835gj","text":"RT-qPCR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ngl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnmkf","text":"The instructions below are for use with the EA‚Äôs RT-qPCR master mixes for the N1 and phi6 assays. Alternative RT-qPCR master mixes and cycling conditions may also be used if they follow the general requirements listed in ‚ÄúGeneral requirements for RT-qPCR master mixes‚Äù (page 5) and below and have been demonstrated to give equivalent results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qdki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pp94","text":"General requirements for RT-qPCR set-up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2amdn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmft7","text":"RT-qPCR should be carried out using the primers and probes outlined in ‚ÄúRT-qPCR PCR master mixes‚Äù.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6peqf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jb5n","text":"Full sets of RT-qPCR controls and quantification standards should be used for every plate where sample RNA is assayed for that RT-qPCR target. For example, if a single RT-qPCR plate is to be used to analyse both SARS-CoV-2 and phi6 simultaneously, no template control (NTC) and ssRNA standard dilutions will be needed for both targets on the same plate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hu68","text":"Prepare RT-qPCR master mixes immediately before starting procedure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jcl0","text":"Sample RNA and ssRNA quantification standards should be kept separate. It is preferable that they are added to the RT-qPCR plate in separate laboratories to avoid the potential for contamination of samples by ssRNA quantification standard. However, it is also possible to maintain separation of sample RNA and ssRNA quantification standards by using automated liquid handling systems. Laboratories must ensure that local quality procedures are maintained to reduce the possibility of cross contamination of this sort.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vg9n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ua5","text":"Analysis of results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31j58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nofq","text":"Quality of amplification data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jvgb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e63p","text":"Analyse the amplification plots using the approach recommended by the manufacturer of the realtime PCR machine. The threshold should ideally be set so that it crosses the area where the amplification plots (logarithmic view) are parallel (the exponential phase).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qurn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpp78","text":"Check all amplification plots to identify false positive results caused by high or uneven background signal (Figure 1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf9pl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bviu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"62nfg","text":"Results for any wells affected in this way should be regarded as negative.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abfs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nppj","text":"Check all amplification plots to identify true positive plots where the recorded quantification cycle (Cq) value is significantly distorted by high or uneven background signal. Approximate correct Cq values should be noted (in addition to the recorded value) for any wells affected in this way. Corrected Cq values should be used for all quantity calculations. Figure 2 shows a case where the recorded Cq value was 15.5, however it should be noted by the analyst that the correct figure should be e.g. 34.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"196i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6htc6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"90cen","text":"Status of controls","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6332n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s1uq","text":"No template controls (NTC)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qin8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brein","text":"Expected result: No amplification of N1, no amplification of phi6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9oj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vqv0","text":"Explanation: A positive result for the NTC indicates background contamination of the RT-qPCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buj0k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehk1a","text":"Outcome of unexpected result: Repeat the entire RT-qPCR plate. The RT-qPCR set-up environment should be decontaminated. Also consider replacing PCR plasticware, TEX buffer, primer and probe working aliquots and RT-qPCR master mix. If contamination of NTC continues following multiple RTqPCR repeats, investigate potential contamination sources and resolve as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"405gc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"432sn","text":"Total blank control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aff6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cirda","text":"Expected result: No amplification of N1, no amplification of phi6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"207hi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32jon","text":"Explanation: A positive result for the total blank control indicates that there was contamination of the control at some point within the sample preparation process. Phi6 recoveriess are used as quality assurance parameters only and not used to adjust test results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9he9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s982","text":"Preparation of this control material requires bacterial culture facilities including incubator(s), culture consumables and media. steps.section: Preparation of daily phi6 process control working suspensions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ksf5","text":"On each day of testing, a new batch of phi6 process control working suspension should be made.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of daily phi6 process control working suspensions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4o8gu","text":"Remove an aliquot of phi6 stock from the freezer (prepared according to Appendix 1), thaw and mix thoroughly by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of daily phi6 process control working suspensions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e27n2","text":"Create a working suspension of phi6 by adding phi6 stock to Ringer‚Äôs ¬º Strength Solution to a final volume of 50¬±0.5 ml and mixing thoroughly by inverting several times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fgh2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13jk8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7cehc","text":"The volumes of phi6 stock required will depend on the concentration of phi6 on the stock. The final concentration of phi6 in the working suspension needs to be high enough so that a 0.01% recovery can be quantified.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8bbve","text":"Larger volumes of phi6 process control working suspensions can also be made using the same proportions of phi6 stock to Ringer‚Äôs ¬º Strength Solution if large numbers of samples are to be processed in a single day.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er403","text":"Mix each sample by inverting the sample bottle 10 times within a biological safety cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clm63","text":"Measure approximately   of sample into a suitable centrifuge bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8b6bk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"911dm","text":"Prepare at least two control centrifuge bottles with approximately   of spring water on each day of testing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"43sap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n3j2","text":"Place the centrifuge rotor into a biological safety cabinet and carefully remove the samples from the rotor being careful not to disturb the pelleted solids.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72t8f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4iuvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fgkkg","text":"If it is not feasible to remove the rotor from the centrifuge, then consideration should","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fj6sp","text":"be made for how to deal with potential aerosolised wastewater in the event of a centrifuge","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bifvp","text":"bottle breakage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ogig","text":"On a digital balance, carefully decant 150¬±1 g of the clarified supernatant into clean centrifuge bottles, being careful to minimise the amount of pelleted solids that are transferred.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oodt","text":"To each   clarified sample and one of spring water control samples, add 1¬±0.01 ml of phi6 process control. Mix the samples well by shaking or inverting several times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dg0ib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ub98","text":"Pour the sample/phi6 mixtures in to centrifuge bottles containing 60¬±1 g of ammonium sulphate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdh77","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"djp99","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cr26h","text":"The spring water control bottle with phi6 is the phi6 positive control, and the other spring water control is the total blank control.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1dbc5","text":"The pellet in the centrifuge bottles can be disposed as biohazardous waste.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72rd1","text":"Dissolve the ammonium sulphate by inverting the bottles several times, or by shaking on an orbital shaker at approximately   until all of the ammonium sulphate has dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"35ov0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"200","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"52snh","text":"Incubate the samples at 3¬±2¬∞C for at least 60 to 180 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
